page.title: 02 WOODBRIDGE TIDE MILL
page.content:
The Woodbridge Tide Mill is a beautiful white building overlooking the River Deben.
The Tide Mill was made as an {economic way of grinding corn}. There has been a tide mill in Woodbridge since 1170.
It has been owned by such people as King Henry the Eighth, Thomas Seckford and is now owned by the Woodbridge Tide Mill Trust.
It is powered by a water wheel 18 foot in diameter which works all the machinery in the mill, including the pair of{ French burr stones} that grind the corn. The granary stands nearby.
